ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] minotaur horn change?
ygData.msgSnippet: Argh It s not an item flag!  It s an option in the client to just not allow you to drop items.  It could be a no drop/trade switch for all I care so you just
ygData.messageBody:
Argh

It's not an item flag! It's an option in the client to just not allow you
to drop items. It could be a no drop/trade switch for all I care so you
just can't click it in an empty area. It has _nothing_ to do with your
equipment other than not letting you dump it on the ground.

And to those who think it's a difficult code change:

The client already checks to see if you are dropping the item or if you are
giving it to someone. All they'd need to do is add a flag:

If Drop and playerwantsdrops=yes then item drops
Else item stays

That's really rudimentary pseudo code but it would be VERY easy to stick
into the client code. It's not even a server side check.

Lyrnia

----- Original Message -----
From: "Jeffrey Sue" <jsue@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, June 02, 2000 4:31 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] minotaur horn change?


> At 04:06 PM 6/2/00 -0400, you wrote:
> >Uhh your options would only affect you, not others. Why would you not
give
> >that option to players on PVP servers? your private settings on your pc
> >don't affect other players. It's a personal setting, just like the
'prompt
> >on destroy' option we already have.
> >
> >**tries to figure out why this is such a difficult concept to grasp**
>
> items flagged as no drop (currently with the NO DROP text in their
description)
> cannot be looted by others when they pvp kill you.
>
> yes i agree, i don't see why this is such a difficult concept to grasp.
oh, i guess
> unless you have never participated in a pvp server and thus don't know how
it works.
>
> >Lyrnia Jongleur
> >The Baffled Bard
>
